CSSStyleSheet.summary: The CSSStyleSheet interface represents a single CSS stylesheet, and lets you inspect and modify the list of rules contained in the stylesheet. It inherits properties and methods from its parent, .

remarks.para: A stylesheet consists of a collection of objects representing each of the rules in the stylesheet. The rules are contained in a , which can be obtained from the stylesheet's property.
For example, one rule might be a object containing a style such as:
Another rule might be an at-rule such as @import or @media, and so forth.

See the Obtaining a StyleSheet section for the various ways a CSSStyleSheet object can be obtained. A CSSStyleSheet object can also be directly constructed. The constructor, and the , and methods are newer additions to the specification, enabling Constructable Stylesheets.

CSSStyleSheetOwnerRule.summary:
The read-only property
ownerRule returns the
corresponding to the @import at-rule which imported the stylesheet into
the document. If the stylesheet wasn't imported into the document using
_import, the returned value is null.
CSSStyleSheetOwnerRule.value:
A corresponding to the {{cssxref("@import")}} rule which
imported the stylesheet into the document. If the stylesheet wasn't imported into the
document using _import, the returned value is null.

CSSStyleSheetDeleteRule.summary:
The method
deleteRule() removes a rule from the stylesheet
object.

remarks.para:
-CSS Object Model
-Constructable Stylesheets (web.dev)
-Using dynamic styling information
-

CSSStyleSheetCSSStyleSheet.summary: The CSSStyleSheet() constructor creates a new object which represents a single Stylesheet.

remarks.para: After constructing a stylesheet the , , , and methods can be used to modify the rules of the new stylesheet.

A stylesheet created using this method is referred to as a "constructed stylesheet".
A constructed stylesheet can be shared between a document and its shadow DOM subtrees using and .

CSSStyleSheetCssRules.summary:
The read-only property
cssRules returns a live which
provides a real-time, up-to-date list of every CSS rule which comprises the
stylesheet. Each item in the list is a defining a single
rule.
CSSStyleSheetCssRules.value:
A live-updating containing each of the CSS rules making up
the stylesheet. Each entry in the rule list is a object
describing one rule making up the stylesheet.

CSSStyleSheetReplaceSync.summary: The replaceSync() method of the interface synchronously replaces the content of the stylesheet with the content passed into it.

remarks.para: The replaceSync() and methods can only be used on a stylesheet created with the constructor.

CSSStyleSheetRemoveRule.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The obsolete method
removeRule() removes a rule from the stylesheet
object. It is functionally identical to the standard, preferred method
.

blockquote.para:
This is a legacy method which has been replaced by
the standard method . You
should use that instead.

CSSStyleSheetReplace.summary: The replace() method of the interface asynchronously replaces the content of the stylesheet with the content passed into it. The method returns a promise that resolves with the CSSStyleSheet object.

remarks.para: The replace() and methods can only be used on a stylesheet created with the constructor.

CSSStyleSheetInsertRule.summary:
The CSSStyleSheet.insertRule()
method inserts a new CSS rule into the current style sheet.

blockquote.para:
Although insertRule() is exclusively a method of
, it actually inserts the rule into
{{domxref("CSSStyleSheet", "", "", "1")}}.cssRules â€” its internal
.

CSSStyleSheetInsertRule.returns: The newly inserted rule's index within the stylesheet's rule-list.

CSSStyleSheetAddRule.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The obsolete interface's
addRule() legacy method adds a new rule to the
stylesheet. You should avoid using this method, and should instead use the more standard
method.
CSSStyleSheetAddRule.returns:
Always returns -1.Note that due to somewhat esoteric rules about where you can legally insert rules,
it's possible that an exception may be thrown. See for more information.

CSSStyleSheetRules.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated rules is a deprecated
legacy property of the interface. Functionally
identical to the preferred property,
it provides access to a live-updating list of the CSS rules comprising the
stylesheet.

blockquote.para:
As a legacy property, you should not use rules and
should instead use the preferred .
While rules is unlikely to be removed soon, its availability is not as
widespread and using it will result in compatibility problems for your site or app.

CSSStyleSheetRules.value:
A live-updating containing each of the CSS rules making up
the stylesheet. Each entry in the rule list is a object
describing one rule making up the stylesheet.
